config_description: /** * Database setting QUERY_CACHE_SIZE (default: 8). * The size of the query cache, in number of cached statements. Each session * has it's own cache with the given size. The cache is only used if the SQL * statement and all parameters match. Only the last returned result per * query is cached. The following statement types are cached: SELECT * statements are cached (excluding UNION and FOR UPDATE statements), CALL * if it returns a single value, DELETE, INSERT, MERGE, UPDATE, and * transactional statements such as COMMIT. This works for both statements * and prepared statement. */
developer_understanding_on_working: The QUERY_CACHE_SIZE configuration determines the size of the query cache in the system. Each session has its own cache with the specified size. The cache is used to store the last returned result per query if the SQL statement and all parameters match.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a new session is created in the system, as each session has its own query cache with the specified size.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the QUERY_CACHE_SIZE configuration option is that it can affect the memory usage of the system. A larger cache size can improve performance by reducing the need to re-execute queries, but it can also increase memory usage. On the other hand, a smaller cache size may save memory but could result in more frequent query executions.
